content.content:
1→# alignment-hive
     2→
     3→Shared infrastructure for alignment researchers. [MATS](https://www.matsprogram.org/) fellows are the first intended users, but this is built for the broader AI safety community.
     4→
     5→Large orgs benefit from shared tooling and accumulated knowledge across their agents. This project aims to bring some of those advantages to independent researchers:
     6→
     7→- **Plugin marketplace** - Curated Claude Code plugins with skills for common research workflows
     8→- **hive-mind** - A system for sharing session learnings across the community (in development)
     9→
    10→## Installation
    11→
    12→### Prerequisites
    13→
    14→Install [Claude Code](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/overview) if you haven't already:
    15→```bash
    16→curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash
    17→```
    18→
    19→### Add the marketplace
    20→
    21→Run the following commands from within Claude Code (the `/` prefix indicates a Claude Code command):
    22→```
    23→/plugin marketplace add Crazytieguy/alignment-hive
    24→```
    25→
    26→Enable auto-update to get new plugins and updates automatically:
    27→1. Run `/plugin`
    28→2. Go to the **Marketplaces** tab
    29→3. Select **alignment-hive**
    30→4. Select **Enable auto-update**
    31→5. Press **Esc** twice to exit the menu
    32→
    33→Install the mats plugin (recommended for MATS fellows):
    34→```
    35→/plugin install mats@alignment-hive
    36→```
    37→
    38→The mats plugin includes:
    39→- **project-setup** - Guidance for starting new projects with good architecture decisions
    40→- **fellow-handbook** - Quick lookup of MATS policies, compute access, housing, and program logistics
    41→
    42→Also available:
    43→```
    44→/plugin install llms-fetch-mcp@alignment-hive
    45→```
    46→
    47→Adds an MCP server for fetching documentation with [llms.txt](https://llmstxt.org/) support.
    48→
    49→### Start your project
    50→
    51→Exit Claude Code and navigate to your project directory:
    52→```
    53→/exit
    54→```
    55→```bash
    56→cd ~/my-project && claude
    57→```
    58→
    59→Works for both new and existing projects.
    60→
    61→## Contributing
    62→
    63→The [plugin-dev](https://[REDACTED:high-entropy-secret]) plugin auto-installs when you clone this repo, so Claude can help with plugin development.
    64→
    65→Feedback and suggestions welcome—open an issue, send a Slack DM, or reach out however works for you. All changes go through PR review.
    66→
    67→## Web App
    68→
    69→A web interface for hive-mind is in development at [alignment-hive.com](https://alignment-hive.com).
    70→
    71→## Roadmap
    72→
    73→See [docs/roadmap.md](docs/roadmap.md) for what's planned.
    74→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>
